careers

JOIN OUR TEAM!

EMF Power Co is looking for career-driven self-starters who desire a job in the very competitive electrical services industry. We are looking for high energy individuals who are extremely organized, work independently, have strong communication skills, ability to multi-task, customer friendly, and ability to work within stressful environments.

To apply, please send us your résumé today. Thank you.

There are 4 jobs in EMF

Associate Intern, Advanced Manufacturing

Function:

Asset Management

About Us:

EMF is the Digital Industrial Company, transforming industry with software-defined machines and solutions that are connected, responsive and predictive. Through our people, leadership develoent, services, technology and scale, EMF delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry. EMF offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation.

Role Summary/Purpose:

The Associate Intern will assist the EMF Ventures team on a project evaluating investment opport unities in a specific sector of Advanced Manufacturing. By the end of the 10 week internship, the individual will have developed an understanding of potential investment opportunities associated with the sector, and will have summarized the project in a document and presentation for the EMF Ventures team.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Conduct research on 1-2 key areas of potential investment
  • Assist in screening investment opportunities
  • Prepare investment committee pitches for potential deals and help present to senior
  • Participate in deal due diligence & closing
  • Develop and evaluate financial models for potential investments
  • Develop diligence data requests and help manage diligence process with target company
  • Facilitate negotiation of deal documentation

Qualifications/Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree
  • Pursuing Master's degree
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook

Qualifications/Requirements:

  • Educational background in engineering, physical sciences, or other relevant field
  • Working knowledge of Finance and Valuation concepts
  • Demonstrated ability to be a self-starter
  • Ability to multitask while maintaining attention to detail
apply
